page.title: 14DORIS KENNINGHAM COUNCILLOR
page.content: Doris Kenningham is a Wakefield District and local parish councillor, and is chairman of the Social Services Committee.She is 69 years of age and has lived in South Elmsall area for 38 years. Doris left school at 14 and went into service earning 6 shillings a week. Eight girls and two boys in the family father was a miner _MASTERS WEIGHMAN. One brother killed in war, other killed in the pit. Home was 3 bedroom terraced house, without bathroom.On Friday bathnights all the family used the same water in large tin bath in front of kitchen range.Clothes handed down through the family.At Christmas each child given an apple, orange, few sweets and a coin.Other gifts had to be shared. Children played whip and top,skipping shuttlecock and battledore,ball games.
